newsitem.title: UK: Orange to bid for third Netherlands licence.
newsitem.headline: Orange to bid for third Netherlands licence.

text.p: The UK's innovative mobile telephone company Orange Group said on Friday it was linking up with a consortium to bid for the third telecommunications licence in the Netherlands.

Orange said it would bid for the Dutch DCS 1800 licence along with Dutch bank ABN AMRO, a regional Dutch cable and electricity consortium called Enertel and Germany's Deutsche Telekom mobile telephone subsidiary T-Mobil.

"The consortium would wish to secure a rapid rollout and launch of the new cellular network at the earliest opportunity to take advantage of the rapidly growing cellular market in the Netherlands," Orange said in a statement.
